Name: Richards, Mrs. Emily
Remarks: watched a woman reunited with two children, boat had a foot of water as they reached the carpathia

Name: Jacobsohn, Mrs. Amy Frances Christy
Remarks: Family claimed that she was rescued on a raft on the shore of Nova Scotia

Name: Martin, Miss. Mabel Elvina
Transferred?: boat 6 is unlikely, as it had more 1st class passengers or deck crew and lowered with very few (probably not more than 25). Elvina and Bowker Ruth Harwood escaped together. boat 12 or 14 seem more likely as it had more staff on board and left later. when in doubt, pick 14 as the more likely boat as it had more staff and left even later and had more passengers on board.

Name: Bowker, Miss. Ruth Harwood
Transferred?: boat 6 is unlikely, as it had more 1st class passengers or deck crew and lowered with very few (probably not more than 25). Elvina and Bowker Ruth Harwood escaped together. boat 12 or 14 seem more likely as it had more staff on board and left later. when in doubt, pick 14 as the more likely boat as it had more staff and left even later and had more passengers on board.
Remarks: first class restaurant cashier

Name: Silvén, Miss. Lyyli Karoliina
Remarks: left in the last lifeboat on her side which could be 12 or D. 12 more likely, as D is already quite full and she was not transferred from D either.

Name: Sjöblom, Miss. Anna Sofia
Transferred?: got into lifeboat 14 as there are no 3rd class passengers recorded on boat 12 yet. could have been transferred to boat 12 though!

Name: Nasser, Mrs. Adele / Adāl Naṣr Allāh
Transferred?: most likely rescued in 14 and then transferred to 12 or was rescued in 13 because 2nd class and woman fits lots of survivors on that boat

Name: Yazbeck, Mrs. Selini
Transferred?: same boat as her nephews Mubārik, Master. Halīm and Mubārik, Mrs. Amīnah. her account states she was later transferred, there were about 20 women and 5 crewmen on board.

Name: Kantor, Mrs. Miriam
Transferred?: most likely on boat 12 due to her status as 2nd class woman. but 10 is still a strong choice as well.
Remarks: Boat 12 could be more likely due to the majority of female passengers from 2nd class.

Name: Reynalds, Sra. Encarnación
Transferred?: no info, but other Spanish passengers from 2nd class boarded boat 12 so far, thus it is plausible that she did so too.

Name: Hämäläinen, Mrs. Anna
Transferred?: most likely 12 according to her accounts of leaving late and stressed into a boat. boat 12 also has many 2nd class passengers.

Name: Poingdestre, Mr. John Thomas
Profession: was one of the men in charge of the boat

Name: Saalfeld, Mr. Adolphe
Transferred?: was in the smokeroom at the time of collision and he went to the lifeboats on that side afterwards. boat 12 seems most likely according to his accounts and many records suggest it.

Name: Barkworth, Mr. Algernon Henry
Remarks: no accounts, but 12 saved much more

Name: Sunderland, Mr. Victor Francis
Remarks: definitely 12 according to records because he was the first to climb into it

Name: Clench, Mr. Frederick Charles
Profession: was one of the men in charge of the boat

Name: Lightoller, Mr. Charles Herbert
Transferred?: his accounts tell of boat B and that he was transferred to boat 12
Remarks: sailor

Name: O'Connor, Mr. John
Remarks: 4 or 12 picked him up later

Name: Nutbean, Mr. William
Profession: most likely in boat D with Podesta. they both helped during the sinking and afterwards on the Carpathia. They were ordered to get on a boat and most likely left on the same boat later on during the sinking. most likely transferred to boat 12 as the two firemen in the records of 12.

Name: Podesta, Mr. Alfred John Alexander
Profession: most likely in boat D with Nutbean. they both helped during the sinking and afterwards on the Carpathia. They were ordered to get on a boat and most likely left on the same boat later on during the sinking. most likely transferred to boat 12 as the two firemen in the records of 12.

Name: Senior, Mr. Harry
Remarks: most likely got on the same boat as Lightoller as he keeps mentioning him and follows his orders.

Name: McGann, Mr. James
Remarks: no accounts, but 12 saved much more

Name: Prangnell, Mr. George Alexander
Remarks: no accounts, but 12 saved much more

Name: Snow, Mr. Eustace Philip
Remarks: no accounts, but 12 saved much more

Name: Maynard, Mr. Isaac Hiram
Remarks: definitely 12, because he is associated with Joughins experience

Name: Joughin, Mr. Charles John
Remarks: became known to have survived in the water for an exceptionally long time, admitted to hardly feeling the cold, most likely thanks to the alcohol he had imbibed. according to his and Isaac Maynards accounts he was most likely in boat 12.

Name: Whiteley, Mr. Thomas Arthur
Remarks: could have been on boat 12 with Joughin and Maynard, as he was the steward in the same working area as Joughin and was also near the same men the other two describe before the titanic hit the iceberg.

Name: Bride, Mr. Harold Sydney
Remarks: trapped under overturned lifeboat B but survived. most likely in 12 as he was weaker and more injured than others. 12 arrived first.

Name: Daniels, Mr. Sidney Edward
Remarks: no accounts, but 12 saved much more

Name: O'Keefe, Mr. Patrick
Remarks: according to records he was transferred to 12

Name: Gracie, Colonel. Archibald
Remarks: climbed aboard an overturned collapsible lifeboat, chaperoned various unaccompanied women, wrote a book about the disaster, first survivor to die after the disaster

Name: Thayer, Mr. John Borland jr
Remarks: Inspiration for Jack Dawson in James Cameron's Titanic, L.D.Skitmore drew a sketch of the sinking according to his accounts

Name: Hämäläinen, Master. Viljo Unto Johannes
Transferred?: Anna's son is in the same boat as her thus it is most likely boat 12.
